Articles.Content: My god it's full of stars!

My god it's full of stars!

Those are David Bowman's famous last words, and this thread is about your famous last words in the game.

As a new player just starting out on my mission to help the KSP, I have no FLW relating directly to KSP.

Here is a little something though related to a certain TV show / movie;

"What could go wrong? I have a wonderful Capissen 38 engine after all."

(grinning and laughing proudly at what I've built)

'Damn this thing's fast!'

Rocket- afterwards known as 'Murphy's Delta V Chariot'- melted from atmospheric friction 5 km above KSC (thanks Murphy and Deadly Reentry).

(having trouble holding the gravity turn, bird wants to keep yawing starboard towards the ground)

'Maybe turning off the port (of three) engine will help'

Cue unplanned and un-recoverable acrobatic maneuvers at 30 km.

(several times in various situations)

'Meh, I saw Scott Manly do this on Youtube. It's easy.'

Crash, boom, screams.

'Think I'll go watch that video again.'
"Crap, I forgot to press T." I bet you can figure out what happened after that

Ohhhhh...

facepalming after making an obvious mistake

Hmmm... I should probably start slowing down now... I'm sure Dilfred would do it.

-Me, seconds before the Khoine Base incident.
0.0 km as closest approach to space station then matching orbits. Sweet.
"I'm sure the ozone smell suddenly coming from my computer in no way means I'll have trouble with this six thousand part vehicle launch." ~Me, a week or two ago
"That was the worst lander ever. Of all time" - Me, after the Duna-I incident.

"I'm sure the ozone smell suddenly coming from my computer in no way means I'll have trouble with this six thousand part vehicle launch." ~Me, a week or two ago

Wackjob you are back

I think it had been more fitting if the computer exploded, I once launched an condensator so it hit the roof. PSU was set to 110 V, I plugged it to 220 V, heard a strange sound and I saw the problem, opened PSU and changed fuse.

Started it without putting the casing on psu, heard an steaming sound and ducked, an bang and the condensatot blew up

Wackjob you are back

I think it had been more fitting if the computer exploded, I once launched an condensator so it hit the roof. PSU was set to 110 V, I plugged it to 220 V, heard a strange sound and I saw the problem, opened PSU and changed fuse.

Started it without putting the casing on psu, heard an steaming sound and ducked, an bang and the condensatot blew up

Discovered a new way to put very small things in orbit !
"Why has it done THAT?" After my command module sank into the launch vechicle, thus killing the crew and lithobreaking the rocket.

"COM behind COL? No problem!"

Me moments before Jeb did one of his famous fake-death routines on my new SSTO.
"Yes, we can land on the sun, we only have to wait until it's night!" Ã¢â‚¬â€œAnonymous
Hmm, now where did I put those snacks agai-
Maybe I should have checked my delta-v requirements...
Whew, it's hot in here. Better open window!
Kraken? What kraken?
No Jeb don't push that button!

"Relax! It says we're still 150km above the surface."

"No... it says 150m..."

"...

...

Oh."

Jeb: Right, coming in for an aerobraking maneuverer at Jool. Hmm, this angle of entry looks a little steep. Bob, are you sure you did those sums correctly?

Bob: Of course I have, everyone knows its Sine=Opposite/Adjacent.

Eeeeeeeeeeeeee.

Crap.

*chuckles*

*blows a slight raspberry*

Nopenopenopenopenopenopenope.
plenty of time to turn around and slow down for this rendezvous.
There goes 2 years of waiting... GAHDAMNIT!!!!
